title: Pirates Of The Caribbean movie logo
content:
This is obviously heavily customized.  
But what could it be based on?

Thanks.

[Pirates of the Caribbean](http://web.archive.org/web/20100717141134/http:/www.imdb.com/gallery/ss/0325980/POC_teaser_poster.jpg.html?path=gallery&path_key=0325980&seq=3)
author: Jan

comments.content:
Don't know what it was based on - but this can bring you close  
 [http://www.dafont.com/pieces-of-eight.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20100717141134/http:/www.dafont.com/pieces-of-eight.font "http://www.dafont.com/pieces-of-eight.font")

This might help be an inspiration from where it came:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/captain-kidd/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100717141134/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/captain-kidd/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/captain-kidd/")

No based on, but similar:

[Rapscallion by by Ryan Splint from Chank](http://web.archive.org/web/20100717141134/http:/chank.com/freefont_detail.php?sku=1077)

Requires a commercial license if you download it from Chank; no such restriction if you download it from [Dafont](http://web.archive.org/web/20100717141134/http:/typophile.com/wiki/%2520http%253A%252F%252Fwww.dafont.com%252Frapscallion.font) according the Rapscallion.txt file by the designer.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100717141134im_/http:/typophile.com/files/rapscallion_4867.jpg)

Dave Nalle of the scriptorium claimed that the movie/rides/merch use some of his fonts. Might be worth checking out. [http://www.fontcraft.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100717141134/http:/www.fontcraft.com/ "http://www.fontcraft.com/")

How about this:

[http://www.dafont.com/caribbean.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20100717141134/http:/www.dafont.com/caribbean.font "http://www.dafont.com/caribbean.font")

I think some flourishes have been added. Like on the bottom of the P and one of the B's

See lowercase N - pretty good match? I think it could possibly have been made starting with this.

Thanks everyone.  
I actually found a couple of free fonts that work quite well.  
(It’ll be just for a title.)  
I didn’t want it to look too blackletterish/gothicy.  
That’s what I like about this pirate theme interpretation.

I was more or less curious what the origins of that logotype could be.

Previously discussed [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20100717141134/http:/typophile.com/node/1434) and [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20100717141134/http:/typophile.com/node/667). Search is your friend. ;^)
